Introduction.Name: Wood Elves
Introduction.Description: The Wood Elves, known as the Asrai in some tales, or as the Fay Folk of Athel Loren, are a reclusive, secretive and highly isolationist race of Elves that have long ago voluntarily split off from the rest of their kin, preferring instead to live out their lives in Nature's embrace beneath the enchanted forested canopy of Athel Loren. However, other conclaves are known to exist, such as the Eonir of Laurelorn.||From these mystical realms, the Wood Elves have learnt to dwell in concord with the seasons and the weave of life and death that binds all living things together. They are the defenders of the forest, guardians of all things natural and pure. For millennia, the Wood Elves have lived in this state of harmony, lying in wait and hidden from the prying eyes of the wider World.

Artefact.Name: The Spirit Sword
Artefact.SpecialRule: Immediately when an enemy character, champion or monster suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Spirit Sword, both he and the wielder must roll 2D6 and add their respective Leadership values. If the wounded model's total is higher, or the totals are the same, nothing else happens. If the wounded model's total is lower, it immediately suffers a Wound for each point by which its total was exceeded, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: Armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by the Spirit Sword. Furthermore, immediately when an enemy character, champion or monster suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Spirit Sword, both he and the wielder must roll 2D6 and add their respective Leadership values. If the wounded model's total is higher, or the totals are the same, nothing else happens. If the wounded model's total is lower, it immediately suffers a Wound for each point by which its total was exceeded, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Daith's Reaper
Artefact.Description: All failed To Hit and To Wound rolls made with Daith's Reaper must be re-rolled, as must all successful armour saves taken against Wounds caused by this weapon.

Artefact.Name: The Bow of Loren
Artefact.SpecialRule: The Bow of Loren is an Asrai longbow with the Multiple Shots (A+1) special rule, which means it fires a number of shots equal to 1 plus the wielder's Attacks characteristic. It cannot fire enchanted arrows
Artefact.Description: The Bow of Loren is an Asrai longbow with the Multiple Shots (A+1) special rule, which means it fires a number of shots equal to 1 plus the wielder's Attacks characteristic. It cannot fire enchanted arrows.

Artefact.Name: The Helm of the Hunt
Artefact.SpecialRule: Devastating Charge
Artefact.Description: The wearer of the Helm of the Hunt counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. Furthermore, the Helm of the Hunt grants the bearer the Devastating Charge special rule and +1 Weapon Skill on a turn in which he charges into combat.

Artefact.Name: Acorns of The Ages
Artefact.SpecialRule: One use only. At the start of the game, after the battlefield has been set up, but before deployment begins, place D3 Citadel Woods on the battlefield. A forest can be placed anywhere at least 1" away from another terrain feature and the edge of the batdefield. Once all forests have been placed, scatter each 2D6". If this scatter causes a forest to end up within 1" (or on top of) other terrain, or within 1" of the batdefield edge, reduce or increase the scatter by the smallest amount necessary to avoid the obstruction. When this has been done, declare which type of forest you want these to be - choose from the types on the Mysterious Forest table. All forests created by the Acorn of the Ages must be of the same type
Artefact.Description: One use only. At the start of the game, after the battlefield has been set up, but before deployment begins, place D3 Citadel Woods on the battlefield. A forest can be placed anywhere at least 1" away from another terrain feature and the edge of the batdefield. Once all forests have been placed, scatter each 2D6". If this scatter causes a forest to end up within 1" (or on top of) other terrain, or within 1" of the batdefield edge, reduce or increase the scatter by the smallest amount necessary to avoid the obstruction. When this has been done, declare which type of forest you want these to be - choose from the types on the Mysterious Forest table. All forests created by the Acorn of the Ages must be of the same type.

Artefact.Name: Moonstone of the Hidden Ways
Artefact.SpecialRule: If the bearer's unit is wholly within a forest at the end of your Movement phase, and is not in close combat, it can forestwalk. If it does so, remove it from the battlefield and immediately replace it, wholly within any forest on the battlefield, in the same formation, but facing am direction. A forestwalking unit cannot be placed within 1" of an enemy unit or impassable terrain. A unit that forestwalks counts as having marched in the Movement phase
Artefact.Description: If the bearer's unit is wholly within a forest at the end of your Movement phase, and is not in close combat, it can forestwalk. If it does so, remove it from the battlefield and immediately replace it, wholly within any forest on the battlefield, in the same formation, but facing am direction. A forestwalking unit cannot be placed within 1" of an enemy unit or impassable terrain. A unit that forestwalks counts as having marched in the Movement phase.

Artefact.Name: Hail of Doom Arrow
Artefact.SpecialRule: One use only. Model with Asrai longbow only. The Hail of Doom arrow can be used instead of making a Shooting attack with the bearer's Asrai longbow. Declare that the Hail of Doom Arrow is being used before any dice are rolled. Range 30", Strength 4, Armour Piercing, Multiple SHots (3D6)
Artefact.Description: One use only. Model with Asrai longbow only. The Hail of Doom arrow can be used instead of making a Shooting attack with the bearer's Asrai longbow. Declare that the Hail of Doom Arrow is being used before any dice are rolled. Range 30", Strength 4, Armour Piercing, Multiple SHots (3D6).

Artefact.Name: Calaingors Stave
Artefact.SpecialRule: The bearer generates one less spell than is normal for his Wizard level, but knows the Tree Singing spell
Artefact.Description: The bearer generates one less spell than is normal for his Wizard level, but knows the Tree Singing spell.

Artefact.Name: The Banner of the Eternal Queen
Artefact.SpecialRule: Magic Resistance (3)
Once per game, all models in the same unit as the Banner of the Eternal Queen have the Unbreakable special rule until the end of turn, or until the bearer is slain
Artefact.Description: The bearer has the Magic Resistance (3) special rule. In addition, once per game, all models in the same unit as the Banner of the Eternal Queen have the Unbreakable special rule until the end of turn, or until the bearer is slain (whichever comes first). Declare you are using this ability at the start of any turn.

Artefact.Name: The Banner of the Hunter King
Artefact.SpecialRule: Vanguard deployment special rule
Unit re-roll their first failed charge of the game
Artefact.Description: All models in the same unit as the Banner of the Hunter King have the Vanguard deployment special rule. In addition, the bearer's unit re-roll their first failed charge of the game.

Artefact.Name: Giant Blade
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with this sword are resolved at +3 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Bloodshed
Artefact.Description: The wielder has +3 Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Blade
Artefact.Description: Armour saves cannot be taken against wounds caused by the Obsidian Blade.

Artefact.Name: Ogre Blade
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with this sword are resolved at +2 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Strife
Artefact.Description: This wieider of the Sword of Strife has +2 Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Fencer's Blades
Artefact.Description: Paired weapons. The bearer has Weapon Skill 10.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Anti-Heroes
Artefact.SpecialRule: +1 Strength and +1 Attack for every enemy character in base contact
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +1 Strength and +1 Attack for every enemy character in base contact with him or his unit. These bonuses are calculated at the start of each round ol close combat and last until its end.

Artefact.Name: Spellthieving Sword
Artefact.SpecialRule: A Wizard that suffers unsaved wounds from the Spellthieving Sword loses one of his spells
Artefact.Description: A Wizard that suffers unsaved wounds from the Spellthieving Sword loses one of his spells (determined randomly) for each unsaved wound.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Swift Slaying
Artefact.Description: The wieider of the Sword of Swift Slaying has the Always Strikes First special rule.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: The wieider tins +1 Attack.

Artefact.Name: Berserker Sword
Artefact.Description: The bearer has the Frenzy special rule and can never lose his Frenzy.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with this sword are resolved at +1 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Gold Sigil Sword
Artefact.Description: Attacks from the Gold Sigil Sword are made at Initiative 10.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Sword of Striking receive a +1 bonus to hit.

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made by the Biting Blade are armour piercing.

Artefact.Name: Relic Sword
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Relic Sword will always wound on a 5+, unless they would normally need a lower result.

Artefact.Name: Shrieking Blade
Artefact.Description: The bearer causes Fear.

Artefact.Name: Tormentor Sword
Artefact.SpecialRule: A monster or character that suffers an unsaved wound has the Stupidity special rule for the rest of the game
Artefact.Description: A monster or character that suffers an unsaved wound from the Tormentor sword has the Stupidity special rule for the rest of the game.

Artefact.Name: Warrior Bane
Artefact.SpecialRule: A monster or character that suffers unsaved wounds from Warrior Bane permanently loses one Attack for each unsaved wound
Artefact.Description: A monster or character that suffers unsaved wounds from Warrior Bane permanently loses one Attack for each unsaved wound (to a minimum of Attacks 1).

Artefact.Name: Armour of Destiny
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Armour of Destiny grants the wearer a 4+ ward save.

Artefact.Name: Trickster's Helm
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. Any successful roll to wound made against the wearer of the Trickster's Helm must be re-rolled.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Silvered Steel
Artefact.Description: The Armour of Silvered Steel grants its wearer a 2+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Fortune
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Armour of Fortune grants the wearer a 5+ ward save.

Artefact.Name: Helm of Discord
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, choose an enemy character in base contact with the bearer or his unit. That character must immediately take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the character succumbs to the helm's sibilant whispers of malice and jealousy. In this Close Combat phase, the victim cannot make attacks and is hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Glittering Scales
Artefact.Description: Light armour. Enemies suffer a -1 to hit penalty when attempting to strike the wearer in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Shield of Ptolos
Artefact.SpecialRule: 1+ armour save against shooting attacks
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer has a 1+ armour save against shooting attacks.

Artefact.Name: Spellshield
Artefact.SpecialRule: Magic Resistance(1)
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer gains Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Gambler's Armour
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Gambler's Armour grants the wearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Dragonhelm
Artefact.SpecialRule: 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. The wearer has a 2+ ward save against flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Enchanted Shield
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer counts his armour save as being two points higher than normal, rather than the usual one point that a shield would normally grant.

Artefact.Name: Charmed Shield
Artefact.SpecialRule: First hit suffered is discounted on a roll of 2+
Artefact.Description: Shield. One use only. The first hit suffered by the bearer of the Charmed Shield is discounted on a roll of 2+.

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Preservation
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Preservation grants the bearer a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Lodestone
Artefact.SpecialRule: Magic Resistance(3)
Artefact.Description: The Obsidian Lodestone grants Magic Resistance (3).

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Endurance
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Endurance grants the bearer a 5+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Dawnstone
Artefact.Description: The bearer re-rolls failed armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Opal Amulet
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Opal Amulet bestows a 4+ Ward save against the first wound suffered by the bearer, after which its power fades and it cannot be used again during the game.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Trinket
Artefact.SpecialRule: Magic Resistance(1)
Artefact.Description: The Obsidian Trinket grants Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Protection grants the bearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Seed of Rebirth
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Seed of Rebirth has the Regeneration (6+) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Dragonbane Gem
Artefact.SpecialRule: 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Dragonbane Gem has a 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Pidgeon Plucker Pendant
Artefact.SpecialRule: 5+ Ward save against wounds caused in close combat by models that have the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: This item grants the bearer a 5+ Ward save against wounds caused in close combat by models that have the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Luckstone
Artefact.SpecialRule: May re-roll single failed armour save
Artefact.Description: The Luckstone allows the bearer to re-roll single failed armour save.

Artefact.Name: Rampager's Standard
Artefact.SpecialRule: May re-roll charge distance dice
Artefact.Description: A unit with this magic standard can re-roll its charge distance dice.

Artefact.Name: Wailing Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner causes Terror in its enemies.

Artefact.Name: Ranger's Standard
Artefact.SpecialRule: Strider
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Ranger's Standard has the Strider special rule.

Artefact.Name: Razor Standard
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Razor Standard have the Armour Piercing special rule.

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner adds +1 to combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Swiftness
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Banner of Swiftness have +1 to their Movement characteristic.

Artefact.Name: Lichebone Pennant
Artefact.SpecialRule: Magic Resistance(1)
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Lichebone Pennant have Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Standard of Discipline
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Standard of Discipline have +1 Leadership, but cannot use the General's Inspiring Presence special rule.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Eternal Flame
Artefact.SpecialRule: Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Banner of Eternal Flame have Flaming Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Gleaming Pennant
Artefact.SpecialRule: Сan re-roll first failed Leadership test
Artefact.Description: One use only. A unit with the Gleaming Pennant can re-roll its first failed Leadership test.

Artefact.Name: Scarecrow Banner
Artefact.SpecialRule: Сauses Fear in models with the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Scarecrow Banner causes Fear in models with the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Book of Ashur
Artefact.SpecialRule: +1 bonus on attempts to cast and dispel
Artefact.Description: The bearer receives a +1 bonus on attempts to cast and dispel.

Artefact.Name: Feedback Scroll
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, roll a dice for every dice used to cast the spell, the casting Wizard takes a wound for every result of 5+ rolled, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Feedback Scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but, after the spell has been resolved, roll a dice for every dice used to cast the spell. The casting Wizard takes a wound for every result of 5+ rolled, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Scroll of Leeching
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, add a number of dispel dice to your pool equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Scroll of Leeching can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but, after the spell has been resolved, the bearer of the scroll adds a number of dispel dice to his pool equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell (remember that your dispel pool cannot exceed 12 dice).

Artefact.Name: Sivejir's Hex Scroll
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, the enemy wizard must roll equal to or under his wizard level on a D6, if he fails he becomes a small, slimy toad
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Hex Scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but a portion of the spell's energy is transformed and redirected at the caster. The enemy wizard can resist the spell's effects by rolling equal to or under his wizard level on a D6. If he fails, an amphibian transformation takes hold and he becomes a small, slimy toad! Whilst transformed, the wizard cannot channel or cast spells, all of his magic items and mundane equipment (armour, weapons, etc.) temporarily stop working and all of his characteristics are reduced to 1 (except for his wounds, which are unaffected). His controlling player can roll a D6 at the start of each of his subsequent magic phases; the spell dissipates on a roll of 4+ and the wizard returns to his normal form (but still attempts to eat flies for several days afterward).

Artefact.Name: Power Scroll
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, during one casting attempt any roll of a double will cause Irresistible Force (and a Miscast)
Artefact.Description: One use only. A Power Scroll can be used when the Wizard makes a casting attempt. During that casting attempt, any roll of a double will cause irresistible force (and a miscast).

Artefact.Name: Wand of Jet
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, can increase one of his casting results by an additional +D6, after other casting dice have been rolled
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer can increase one of his casting results by an additional +D6, after other casting dice have been rolled. This extra power dice can contribute to casting a spell with Irresistible Force (and a Miscast).

Artefact.Name: Forbidden Rod
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, adds +D6 dice in the power pool and inflicts D3 wounds
Artefact.Description: One use only. The forbidden rod adds +D6 dice in the power pool at the start of the caster's own magic phase, but also inflicts D3 wounds on the bearer (with no armour saves allowed).

Artefact.Name: Trickster's Shard
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, declare you are using Shard at the start of one of your magic phases, for the duration of the phase, when one of spells is dispelled by an enemy wizard, on a 5+, that wizard surfers a wound with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: One use only. Declare you are using this item at the start of one of your magic phases. For the duration of the phase, when one of the bearer's spells is dispelled by an enemy wizard, roll a D6. On a 5+, that wizard surfers a wound with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Earthing Rod
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, can re-roll the Miscast
Artefact.Description: One use only. If the wizard rolls on the miscast table he can re-roll the result.

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a wizard who has a dispel scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell by using dispel dice. This automatically dispels the enemy spell; no dice roll is required. Note that even a dispel scroll will not help if the spell has been cast with Irresistible Force. Note also that a dispel scroll cannot be used to dispel spells that remain in play other than at the moment they are cast.

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Wizard can declare that he is using the power stone immediately before casting a spell. If he does so, two extra dice are added to the power dice that he is going to roll (you still need to roll at least one dice from the power pool).

Artefact.Name: Sceptre of Stability
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, can choose to increase one of his dispel results by an additional +D6, after his other dispel dice have been rolled
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer can choose to increase one of his dispel results by an additional +D6, after his other dispel dice have been rolled. This extra dispel dice can contribute to dispelling with Irresistible Force.

Artefact.Name: Channelling Staff
Artefact.SpecialRule: +1 to all of his channeling attempts
Artefact.Description: The Wizard adds +1 to all of his channeling attempts.

Artefact.Name: Scroll of Shielding
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, the target of the spell is granted a 4+ Ward save against any wounds caused by the spell
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Scroll of Shielding can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but the target of the spell is granted a 4+ Ward save against any wounds caused by the spell.

Artefact.Name: Wizarding Hat
Artefact.Description: The wearer is treated as being a Level 2 Wizard who can use a randomly chosen spell lore. However, he also has the Stupidity special rule.

Artefact.Name: Fozzrik's Folding Fortress
Artefact.SpecialRule: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress
Artefact.Description: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building (or scratch-built structure of a similar size) in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress. This is treated as a standard building. If you do not have a suitable building to place, you cannot use Fozzrik's Folding Fortress.

Artefact.Name: Arabyan Carpet
Artefact.SpecialRule: Fly
Artefact.Description: Infantry or monstrous infantry models on foot only. The owner of this magical carpet has the Fly special rule. However, he cannot join units.

Artefact.Name: Crown of Command
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Crown of Command has the Stubborn special rule.

Artefact.Name: Healing Potion
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per battle recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Healing Potion can be drunk at the start of the controlling player's turn. The imbiber immediately recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle.

Artefact.Name: Featherfoe Torc
Artefact.SpecialRule: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat
Artefact.Description: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Ruby Ring of Ruin
Artefact.SpecialRule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Fireball spell from Lore of Fire
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (power level 3). The Ruby Ring of Ruin contains the Fireball spell (see the Lore of Fire).

Artefact.Name: The Terrifying Mask of Eee!
Artefact.Description: The wearer of this mask causes Terror. However, other models can never use his Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Strength
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Strength until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Strength can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Strength until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Toughness
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Toughness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: The Other Trickster's Shard
Artefact.Description: Models in base contact with the bearer (friends and foes) must re-roll successful ward saves.

Artefact.Name: Ironcurse Icon
Artefact.SpecialRule: The character (and any unit he is with) have 6+ Ward save against war machine weapons
Artefact.Description: The character (and any unit he is with) gain a 6+ ward save against war machine weapons.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Foolhardiness
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per battle character has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Foolhardiness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Speed
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Speed can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn.

Hero.Name: Orion
Hero.Description: Orion, The King in the Woods

HandWeapon.Name: Spear of Kurnous
HandWeapon.SpecialRule: A missile weapon with the Range 18", Strength 7 and Multiple Shots (D3)

RangeWeapon.Name: Hawk's Talon
RangeWeapon.SpecialRule: A missile weapon with the Range 30", Strength 5 and Multiple Shots (6)

Armour.Name: Cloak of Isha
Armour.SpecialRule: At the start of each of your turns, roll a D6. On a score of 6, Orion regains a Wound lost earlier in the battle

Armour.Name: Horn of the Wild Hunt
Armour.SpecialRule: At the start of each turn, the Horn of the Wild Hunt grants the Devastating Charge special rule to Orion, his unit, and all friendly Wood Elf units within 6"

Special.SpecialRule: If Orion is accompanied by Hounds of Orion, they must be deployed as a unit (even though as a monster, Orion is not normally permitted to join units). Orion cannot leave this unit, and cannot join other units
+1 to all attempts to cast spells

A model can choose to make a single Tree Whack in place of making his normal close combat attacks. It must be declared before rolling To Hit. To resolve a Tree Whack, nominate an enemy model in base contact. That model must pass an Initiative test or suffer D6 Wounds with no armour saves allowed. A character with this special rule may make a Tree Whack in a challenge.
Can make the shooting attack with Range 12", Strength 2, Multiple Shots (2D6) and Killing Blow special rule

RangeWeapon.Name: Skarvn the Eye Thief
RangeWeapon.SpecialRule: At the start of each of your turns, nominate a single enemy model within 18" of Araloth. That model takes a Strength 4 hit. If the Wound is unsaved, and the To Wound roll was a 6, the model suffers a -5 penalty to Weapon Skill and Initiative (to a minimum of 1) for the rest of the game. A model can only suffer this penalty once

Special.SpecialRule: Whilst Araloth is a lone character, he has the Unbreakable special rule (this replaces Stubborn)

Once both sides have deployed, but before the first turn begins, check to see if the enemy General is within 36" and within line of sight of at least one of your models with this special rule. If he is, he immediately suffers a single Strength 3 hit against which no armour saves can be taken. Otherwise, nothing happens
+1 to all attempts to cast spells
+1 to all attempts to cast spells

A model can choose to make a single Tree Whack in place of making his normal close combat attacks. It must be declared before rolling To Hit. To resolve a Tree Whack, nominate an enemy model in base contact. That model must pass an Initiative test or suffer D6 Wounds with no armour saves allowed. A character with this special rule may make a Tree Whack in a challenge.

Option.Name: Strangleroots
Option.SpecialRule: Shooting attack with Range 12", Strength 5 and Multiple Shots(D6+1)

Special.SpecialRule: +1 to all attempts to cast spells

Each time Drycha suffers an unsaved Wound, her Attacks characteristic increases by 2 for the remainder of the battle. Each time Drycha regains a Wound lost earlier in the batde, her Attacks characteristic decreases by 2 for the remainder of the battle

This rule cannot be used if there are no forests on the battlefield when it is time to deploy vour army. When you deploy, you may choose D3 units wholly composed of the models with Forest Spirit special rule - thes are not deployed at the start of the game, but are 'slumbering' somewhere on the battiefield. At the start of the Remaining Moves sub-phase of your first turn, roll a D6 for each slumbering unit. On a roll of 1-2, nothing happens - roll again next turn. On a roll of 3-6, the unit awakens Place it on the battlefield so that all models in the unit are wholly within a forest, and at least 1" away from other units and impassable terrain. Treat units that cannot be placed as having rolled a 1-2. Any units that have not yet awoken by the timf the game ends award victory points as if they had been destroyed.

Once both sides have deployed, but before the first turn begins, check to see if the enemy General is within 36" and within line of sight of at least one of your models with this special rule. If he is, he immediately suffers a single Strength 3 hit against which no armour saves can be taken. Otherwise, nothing happens
+1 to all attempts to cast spells

Once both sides have deployed, but before the first turn begins, check to see if the enemy General is within 36" and within line of sight of at least one of your models with this special rule. If he is, he immediately suffers a single Strength 3 hit against which no armour saves can be taken. Otherwise, nothing happens

At the start of each round of close combat in which they are fighting, models choose one of the following dances: Whirling Death (Armour Piercing and Killing Blow), Storm of Blades (+1 Attack), The Shadows Coil (3+ ward save); the effect of which lasts until the end of that turn or until a new dance is chosen. This is done before Impact Hits are resolved. All dancers in the same unit must choose the same dance. Dancers cannot choose the same dance in two consecutive rounds of combat

Before a models makes a shooting attack, decide whether it will make afast shot or an aimed shot. If the former is chosen, the model's missile weapon has the Multiple Shots (2) special rule for the duration of that attack. If the latter is chosen, then armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by the attack. Model in the same unit must choose the same type of shot
+1 to all attempts to cast spells
A Unicorn's close combat attacks have a +2 Strength bonus on a turn in which it charges

A Forest Dragon has a Strength 2 Breath Weapon. Armour saves taken against Wounds caused by Soporific Breath suffer a -3 penalty. All models in a unit that suffers one or more hits from Soporific Breath gain the Stupidity special rule for the remainder of the game
If a models is in base contact with at least one enemy model with either the Fear or Terror special rule, it has +1 Attack

At the start of each round of close combat in which they are fighting, models choose one of the following dances: Whirling Death (Armour Piercing and Killing Blow), Storm of Blades (+1 Attack), The Shadows Coil (3+ ward save); the effect of which lasts until the end of that turn or until a new dance is chosen. This is done before Impact Hits are resolved. All dancers in the same unit must choose the same dance. Dancers cannot choose the same dance in two consecutive rounds of combat

Before a models makes a shooting attack, decide whether it will make afast shot or an aimed shot. If the former is chosen, the model's missile weapon has the Multiple Shots (2) special rule for the duration of that attack. If the latter is chosen, then armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by the attack. Model in the same unit must choose the same type of shot

A model can choose to make a single Tree Whack in place of making his normal close combat attacks. It must be declared before rolling To Hit. To resolve a Tree Whack, nominate an enemy model in base contact. That model must pass an Initiative test or suffer D6 Wounds with no armour saves allowed. A character with this special rule may make a Tree Whack in a challenge.

Option.Name: Strangleroots
Option.SpecialRule: Shooting attack with Range 12", Strength 5 and Multiple Shots(D6+1)
